title: Director, HR Technology Strategy
description:
Welcome to the intersection of energy and home services. At NRG, we’re all about propelling the next generation of leaders forward. We are driven by our passion to create a smarter, cleaner and more connected future. We deliver innovative solutions that make our customers’ lives easier—helping them power, protect, and intelligently manage their homes and businesses. To do this, we need creative and talented people to join our company.


We offer a dynamic work environment and a unified and inclusive culture. NRG fosters a strong sense of belonging that leads to better collaboration and business performance. Our company programs are designed to help employees develop the skills they need for success now and in the future. In everything we do, we aim to champion our employees and bring value to our customers, investors and society.


More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

**Job Summary:**

  

The Director, Talent & Culture Technology Strategy will be an essential resource for the Human Resources department. The Technology Strategy Director will work closely with the HR and Information Technology teams to recommend future-state technology strategies to foster a culture of data-based decision-making, streamline HR processes, and enhance the employee experience.

 **Essential Duties/Responsibilities:**

  

Include but not limited to:


* Lead the development of Talent & Culture’s short and long-term technology strategy by collaborating with Senior Leadership to identify areas where improvements in efficiency, productivity, or quality can be made, creating and carrying out strategic business plans
* Be a technology thought-leader in HR, leveraging new technologies – particularly machine learning and AI-based tools – to reimagine HR service delivery. Research and identify new and emerging technologies that will enhance the organization's operating efficiency and support enhanced customer service
* Optimize the organization's technology resources and recommend future technology direction and new technology initiatives
* Partner with Senior HR Leadership to foster a culture of data-based decision-making within HR
* Within the scope of HR technology, identify, design, and support the implementation of process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability while learning the HRIS system/current HR tools
* Evaluate existing business technology resources and recommend new technologies or upgrades/enhancements to existing technologies that have the potential to improve business performance
* Ensure HR’s data architecture supports existing and future requirements of evolving business needs
* Work with HR Centers of Excellence to consider/evaluate operational dashboards, reporting, and tools such as Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI, etc.
* Identify metrics and performance indicators and collect relevant data
* Build a strong collaboration with the IT Data and AI team, ensuring HR’s technology strategy remains aligned with overall company strategy
* Coach and develop direct reports by assessing strengths and developmental needs; provide team with challenging assignments and opportunities for development
* Ensure technology strategy is compliant with laws/regulations

 **Minimum Requirements:**

  

* Minimum of 10 years of corporate experience, including prior management experience
* Minimum of 7 years of well-rounded HR experience supporting different areas of the HR function
* High School Diploma or GED equivalent
* Experience with business process improvement strategies
* Experience with any one of visualization tools like Spotfire/Tableau/Power BI or other business intelligence tools
* Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement

**Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Bachelor's degree in a technology-related discipline preferred. Master’s degree a plus

**Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

  

* Demonstrated ability to influence others and well-developed leadership abilities to create a positive rapport with others
* Strong organizational skills and comfort interacting with different lines of business, IT and senior management
* Business intelligence skills
* Proficient in effectively communicating to a wide range of audiences, both written and oral
* Ability to evaluate and learn new technologies quickly, keeping up to date on new emerging technologies.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability in planning, direction, and goal setting for the department or function in alignment with organizational objectives
* Ability to work with all levels of the company, from front-line employees to senior leadership
* Broad and in-depth understanding of human resources policies and procedures
* Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment.
* Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality
* Demonstrated ability to set priorities and to respond to changing demands from multiple sources
* Proficiency in working independently in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook

**Working Conditions:**

  

* Open office environment
* Hybrid schedule of 4 days in the office, 1 day remote
* Minimal required travel to other locations, occasional overnight travel to other offices as needed (15% of the time)
* Ability to work in an open office environment (sitting, walking, standing, meetings, typing)


NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. EOE AA M/F/Protected Veteran Status/Disability. Level, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.


EEO is the Law Poster (The poster can be found at http://www.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/poster\\_screen\\_reader\\_optimized.pdf)

description:

These responsibilities include providing transportation for clients to court, appointments, and community service, participating in quality assurance activities, recording and reporting on client data, acting as a role model to clients, and maintaining the confidentiality of client information.

title: Farm Operator (Part-Time)
description:
We grow the worlds BEST Strawberries & our Farm Operators are a huge reason why!

  

As part of our Production Team, a**Part-Time Farm Operator**is responsible for the execution of farming and related tasks in a production farm contributing to our exceptional product and plant health. Individuals execute the day-to-day operations of the Farm which includes pruning, harvesting, cleaning, sanitizing and transferring plants.

**What youll be responsible for:**

* Ensure tasks such as pruning, harvesting, and cleaning/sanitizing are completed timely.
* Operate and troubleshoot new farming technologies.
* Manage all stages of the strawberry plant life cycle - propagation, cultivation, pruning, and harvesting.
* Communicate and work cross functionally with packaging and distribution.
* Engage in information and data collection as necessary so that we can continually improve our strawberries.
* Escalate concerns to leadership as necessary to ensure the health and safety of our plants and our people.


The role is hands-on with about 90% of time spent in the farm tending to our plants.

#### **Who will love this job:** ***Individuals who identify with our Core Values and exhibit skills within those values will thrive at Oishii.***

* **One Team, One Fight!**
	+ Ability to quickly shift priorities to meet deadlines and effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, clearly, concisely and with purpose.
	+ Outgoing and collaborative work style- Ability to work cross functionally at all levels and collaborate at various levels of the organization.
* **Focus**
	+ Ability to remove obstacles in order to prioritize which could include problem solving, working through ambiguity and using fact based or sound judgment.
	+ Ability to work independently, with a high attention to detail, and ability to create structure & process where none may exist.
* **GSD (Get Sh\\*\\* Done!)**
	+ Capable of prioritizing tasks and always considering the resources available when doing so.
	+ A bias for action! Ability to hold yourself accountable and take ownership of driving results that impact company outcomes.

#### **Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to lift up to 30 lbs
* Ability to climb a ladder
* Ability to crouch or kneel
* Ability to reach and stretch
* Hand dexterity
* Comfortable in an active non sedentary role for lengths of up to 5 to 6 hours at a time
* MUST NOT be allergic to bees

#### **What We Look for in a Farm Operator:**

* High School Diploma or GED.
* Ability to maintain excellent punctuality and attendance.
* You love strawberries and learning new things!
* You love the natural rhythm of farming and would thrive spending hours every day in a farm caring for plantsexperience with gardening is a plus
* No growing experience necessary, on the job training will be provided.
* Ability to work the following Shift & Schedule:
	+ *Sunday - Tuesday 8 AM - 4:30 PM*

#### **Perks at Oishii:**

* Hourly compensation starts at $17.00/hour
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* 100% Employer Paid Life Insurance + Long Term Disability Insurance
* EAP Access
* Pet Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (Roth & Traditional)
* Paid Parental leave
* Office social events including happy hours, parties, and community service projects
* Employee activity groups for basketball players, Yoga Enthusiasts, runners

#### **About Oishii:**


At Oishii, we grow the best fruit in the world by deploying ground-breaking vertical farming technology that pushes the boundaries of agriculture. Were the first in the WORLD to grow fruit in an indoor vertical farm at commercial scale. We started with strawberries, which we debuted at Chef's Table at Brooklyn Fare, the three star Michelin restaurant considered by critics to be among the best in the world. Since then, we have supplied our strawberries to food-loving consumers, world-class restaurants, and specialty retailers across NYC. Our proprietary technology enables us to grow the very best produce year-round, at the same high level of quality, all without using any pesticides.


Oishii has been profiled in Eater, NPR, Time Magazine, and Fortune. Oishi was also one of the Fast Companies Most Innovative Companies of 2022.


At Oishii, everything we do works toward accomplishing our mission of transforming agriculture sustainably while bringing produce that truly delights people everywhere. This requires farmers, engineers, scientists, product managers, and members of many other backgrounds to work together day-in and day-out to innovate, while operating increasingly large farms. We have an amazing mission-driven team of highly motivated and engaged members.

  

Learn More https://oishii.com/
company_description: Growing delicious fruit by pushing the boundaries of indoor vertical farming.

title: Care Partner
description:
Meridian Senior Living believes that Everyone Deserves a Great Life.


To us, a great life in our communities starts with great employees. What makes a great employee, you ask?


We believe a great employee is someone that understands that our work is hard yet rewarding, that team work truly makes the dream work, and that at the end of the day there is nothing more satisfying then making a difference in someones life.

**What do we offer to these great employees?**

* A solid benefits package (with several different plan options for you to choose from) complete with Medical, Dental, and Vision.
* 1800MD Telemedicine that is available to all employees*and*their family members at no cost! No enrollment required!
* Flexible Spending Account
* Company paid Life Insurance and Long-Term Disability
* Voluntary Benefits that include Short Term Disability, Accident Coverage, Critical Illness, and more!
* Pet Insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* 401K
* Employee Assistance Program
* Referral Bonus
* Employee Discounts (Enterprise, Staples, HD Supply, Office Depot, Sherwin Williams, and more!)

**What else do we offer?**

* We equip you with the ability to grow your career whether it be with us or another employer.
* A company culture that is dedicated to promoting integrity, joy, respect, and excellence!
* Life changing experiences with some of the best Residents an employee can ask for.

**Details about the Caregiver/Resident Assistant position we are hiring for:**


As a Caregiver/Resident Assistant you will provide direct care assisting residents in their daily activities. Responsibilities include bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, positioning, mobility and incontinence care. Additional tasks include keeping proper care records, reporting any changes in residents conditions, interacting effectively with residents, families, staff, vendors and the general public.

* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* High school diploma or equivalent and successfully complete training as required by State regulations.
* Must have compassion for and desire to work with the elderly
* Must demonstrate the ability to work responsibly as a team member as well as an individual.
* Ability to communicate effectively with residents, families, staff, vendors, and the general public.
* Must be honest, fair, dependable, respect confidentiality and the rights and privacy of others.
* Must meet all health requirements and pass background check.

*Meridian Senior Living is an Equal Opportunity Employer*
company_description: Meridian Senior Living - Because Everyone Deserves a Great Life!

title: IT Support Associate
description:
IT Support Associate


Hours: 8:00 am - 4:00 pm


Location: 60 MacDougal


Job Summary:


We are seeking a motivated and tech-savvy Entry-Level IT Helpdesk Technician to join our team at Cooke School and Institute. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a school environment and possess a strong understanding of various IT systems, including Smartboards and Active Directory. This role is essential in providing technical support to our staff and students, ensuring a seamless educational experience.


Key Responsibilities:

* Provide first-level technical support to faculty, staff, and students for hardware and software issues.
* Assist with the setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting of Smartboards and other interactive classroom technologies.
* Manage user accounts and permissions in Active Directory and Jumpcloud, including account creation, modification, and deletion.
* Respond to helpdesk tickets in a timely manner, ensuring effective communication and resolution of issues.
* Assist in the installation and configuration of computers, printers, and other IT equipment.
* Support the integration of educational technology tools and resources in the classroom.
* Maintain inventory of IT equipment and assist with asset management.
* Collaborate with the IT team to identify and implement improvements to existing processes and systems.
* Stay updated on the latest technology trends and best practices in educational IT support.


Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent; an associate degree in Information Technology or a related field is a plus.
* Minimum of 1-2 years experience in IT helpdesk role, or CompTIA A+ or equivalent certification.
* Previous experience in an IT support role, preferably in a school or educational environment.
* Familiarity with Smartboards and other interactive technologies.
* Basic knowledge of Active Directory and user account management.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues effectively.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with a customer-oriented approach.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* A passion for technology and a desire to support educational initiatives.
* Advanced knowledge of IOS and Mac OS systems.
* Ability to Document processes and procedures in an organized and coherent manner
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  

Preferred Skills:

* Experience with Windows and Mac operating systems.
* Knowledge of common software applications used in educational settings (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Workspace).

title: Physical Therapy Aide - On the Job Training Provided
description:
Physical Therapy Aide (ASTORIA, NY) - Work directly under the supervision of a Physical Therapist helping to treat patients with various orthopedic and neurological conditions. Training provided for the right candidates.

Full time or Part time Starts at $16/hour - state your daily and hourly availability when applying Monday to Saturday. We are open 800am to 800pm Monday to Friday and Saturday from 800am to 130pm.

The ideal candidate may be interested in pursuing Physical Therapy as a career and should have knowledge of the human body and anatomy, be versed in physical therapy exercises, have excellent time management, organization, attention to detail, be efficient, prompt, great listener and be able to perform under pressure.

This position is valuable and ideal for candidate who wishes to become a Physical Therapist in the future. It is also very helpful for those who are interested in pursuing medical careers in the future. It provides patient interaction hours and skills you cannot learn in college.

Instructions to apply: Read CAREFULLY start to finish.  
1) Send email with your resume khanpt2124@hotmail.com

2) If your availability is open state open availability Mon to Sat

3) If you have limited availability state your specific availability each day.

We are open 800am to 800pm Monday to Friday and Saturday from 800am to 130pm.

4) If you speak another language (Spanish, Bengali, Arabic, is a strong plus) please state this as well.  
5) Based on your resume you may be offered an interview via email contact.

Candidates should be highly motivated, detail oriented, professional, and able to work independently. No experience is necessary only a REAL INTEREST in the profession of PHYSICAL THERAPY.

Candidates should be highly motivated, detail oriented, professional, and able to work independently. Those already enrolled in Medical Assistant or Allied Health Assistant programs can also apply to satisfy their clinical internship requirements.

title: VP Adtech Product Management & Development
description:
We are seeking a visionary and strategic leader for the role of VP Product Management & Adtech here at Locality. This role is crucial for overseeing product management and development for Locality Streaming, acting as the liaison to department leads and the leadership team for all matters related to Advertising Technology.

* Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle for Locality Streaming, from concept and design through development, launch, and post-launch analysis.
* Act as a liaison to department leads and the leadership team for everything related to Advertising Technology.
* Manage technology stack integrations, including order management systems, proprietary technology, ad servers, DSPs, and reporting systems.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for all AdTech-related initiatives, facilitating communication and collaboration between product, engineering, sales, and other departments.
* Provide regular updates to the leadership team on AdTech developments, performance metrics, and strategic direction.
* Assess potential new software vendors and partners to enhance the AdTech stack.
* Administer the testing of new software or new features from existing partnerships.
* Develop and articulate a clear vision for the AdTech strategy, ensuring all stakeholders understand the direction and goals.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key internal stakeholders, including product, engineering, sales, and marketing teams.
* Act as the public face of Localitys AdTech initiatives at industry conferences, trade shows, and other events by presenting on AdTech advancements, company products, and industry trends to establish thought leadership.
* Build and manage the inventory network and hierarchy, ensuring proper connection to the trafficking system.
* Plan and execute beta tests for new FreeWheel features, coordinating with internal teams and external partners, and analyze test results to provide feedback for improving ad server performance and capabilities.
* Manage inventory acquisition costs, eCPM, and margin management.
* Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is required.
* 10-15+ years of experience in product management, specifically within the AdTech space.
* Extensive experience with ad servers, particularly FreeWheel.
* Deep knowledge of programmatic sales operations, data stacks, and AdTech industry contacts.
* Proven track record of managing business relationships and contracts with vendors such as FreeWheel, Human, STAQ, Operative, AdGreetz.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute product strategies and roadmaps.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and align teams.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of pitching ideas to senior leaders and getting buy-in.
* Natural ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams across complex projects.
* Experience representing companies at industry conferences and events.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

*Compensation for the role includes a competitive salary of $185,000-$210,000 (dependent on years of experience, level of education obtained, as well as applicable skillset) and an excellent benefits package (including but not limited to health care benefits, retirement benefits and paid days off).*

*Locality is a local TV advertising provider on a mission to help brands forge authentic connections with viewers. Locality brings together the best talent in both broadcast and streaming. With more than 11 locations in the US, Locality helps brands tap into the mindset of the local consumer and precisely reach optimal markets, nationally. Having served more than 1,500 ad agencies and 4,500 advertisers, to date, Locality is a one-stop shop, offering the best premium inventory that the industry has to offer to help brands optimize spend and target at scale. For more information, visit**www.locality.com*

title: Meat Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**

  

To deliver a great customer experience while being a leader with excellent people skills and a wide knowledge and experience in all aspects of the Meat department; to maintain a neat, clean, and visually appealing department and to perform other tasks as required safely and efficiently, within the Company policy.


Performance of the essential functions of this position requires the team members to possess the minimum qualifications listed above. These functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Reports to the President.
* Provide leadership to staff, Store Managers, and Department heads including setting clear expectations and holding the team accountable.
* Build sales and profits by executing sales strategies and excellent follow-through at the department level.
* Must ensure the highest product quality, plan-o-gram follow-through, and weekly sales plan execution.
* Provide the merchandising direction and standards for the company.
* Profit and loss responsibility including shrink and related cost controls.
* Train all store Meat department associates (Including Department Head, Fulltime and Part time) in our standards of merchandising, quality product, sanitation, sales plan execution and allowable shrink.
* Monitor competition and provide feedback and recommendations to the President.
* Maintain the highest level of store sanitation, health and safety.
* Maintain the highest level of honesty and integrity.
* Work in an environment that includes continuous duties in refrigerated cutting rooms and storage areas (relatively high humidity) with occasional duties in frozen food storage boxes maintained at temperatures as low as 20 degrees (Fahrenheit) below zero.
* Handle damaged and spoiled products according to Company policy and assist in controlling the level of damaged goods.
* Understand and adhere to all Country of Origin Label (C.O.O.L.) regulations for all products in the Meat Department.
* Understand and adhere to Company shrink guidelines as relates to Meat Department operations.
* Utilize and maintain equipment as required by department; report any equipment problems immediately.
* Checks products received against invoices.
* Check prices and be knowledgeable about the location of items in the store.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Local, State and Federal regulations pertaining to the Meat operation.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Company rules, policies, safety requirements, and security standard and all Local, State and Federal health and civil code regulations.
* Perform duties in accordance with hand washing standards and use disposable gloves when handling food.


The minimum required qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to the following:

* Meat Manager Experience considered.
* Meat Product Specialist Experience considered.
* Product Development Experience considered
* R&D Experience considered.
* Ability to manage a large team of associates with a high degree of integrity and respect.
* Sales builder and profit oriented.
* Experience and knowledge in managing a budget a firm understanding of shrink and cost control essential.
* Excellent communication and people skills.
* Proven track record in successfully training and developing people.
* Computer skills including Microsoft Office.
* Ability to proficiently read, write, speak, analyze, interpret, and understand the English language.
* Ability to stand, bend, twist, reach, push, pull and regularly lift 25 lbs., and occasionally lift up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in varying temperatures.
* Ability to work with fresh, dried and/or processed products, spices and powdered substances without negative allergic consequences.
* Ability to tolerate dust and cleaning agents during routine housekeeping duties.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Job Summary**


What is a Direct Support Professional?


The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for implementing person-centered services for each individual. This includes ensuring implementation of the individuals services, goals, and outcomes in relation to program-based and community inclusion activities. In addition, the Direct Support Professional is solely responsible for the individual's overall physical and emotional well-being.

**Job Responsibilities**


You would be responsible for:

* Under supervision, provide support and services which involve advocating for, encouraging, guiding, and teaching individuals in expressing personal choice, ensuring community integration, assisting individuals with personal hygiene care, toileting, lifts and transfers, dining, dressing, and meal preparation.
* You would help individuals to participate in games and recreational programs; coach and encourage individuals to develop daily living skills; and provide a clean, safe, and comfortable environment.
* You would collaborate with other staff to implement and record care plans and, in accordance with special instructions, you may administer medication. *These positions are physically demanding*.
* You would need to be prepared to act to ensure the health and safety of individuals in emergency situations.
* You will participate in staff meetings, in-service training and on-site workshops as required for professional growth and development. Attending external training and workshops in the direction of direct supervisor or program management. Maintain certification in \\*AMAP, CPR, First Aid and SCIP, as required. ***\\*Note: Failure to maintain AMAP certification can result in removal of full-time employee status.***
* You must be able to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stretch, and lift bedridden and/or incapacitated individuals.
* You will help to promote and support the inclusion of individuals in their community according to their unique needs, interests, and desires. Model and encourage interaction between individuals and community members. Help foster individuals personal growth by assisting in forming and maintaining friendships with neighbors, co-workers, and peers.
* You will help with transporting individuals or assist them in taking public transportation.
* You will assist in maintaining positive communications with family members, advocates, and service providers as per program needs.


To learn more about what direct support professionals do on the job every day, go tohttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cnK4z3KAqtE.

**Qualifications**


You are a good fit if you have:

* High school diploma, GED, CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant certification) or possess a Direct Support Professional (DSP) certificate from an accredited public or private organization.
* One year or more work experience with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.
* Excellent written, communication and mathematical skills.
* Valid NYS driver license preferred but not required.
* A flexible work schedule.


Qualifications

* High School Diploma, GED or CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant) strongly preferred but not required.
* One year or more experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.
* Valid NYS driver's license preferred but not required
* HeartShare requires all new hires to provide proof of the COVID-19 vaccination prior to their start date. Employees who require an accommodation for medical or religious reasons should notify Human Resources.

**About HeartShare**


For over 100 years, HeartShare has dedicated itself to improving the lives of people needing special services and support. The HeartShare team, now 2,100 employees and growing, helps individualsdevelop to their fullest potential and lead meaningful and enriched lives.

**Benefits**


At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.

title: Director-Digital Product Operations
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let’s lead the way together.



How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path. Find your place in risk and analytics on #TeamAmex.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**



We are looking for a passionate, talented, and adaptable product leader to craft and deliver the vision for Acquisition and onboarding experiences. There are three broad pillars in this team – 1. GO2 platform - build the foundational features on GO2 that are leveraged by teams across Customer Acquisitions domain to launch new markets and products. 2. API’s – Create and maintain GO2 API’s for Acquisitions 3. Business Rules function – responsible for enabling processes for Product launches/enhancements through a configuration engine. In this role on the Enterprise Acquisition Products and Platforms team, a key responsibility will be to build and execute the strategy for migration to the new GO2 Unify platform and build a scalable Data Retention and Purge solution for Acquisitions domain. You will lead a high-performing team of Product managers/Product owners and partner with Technology and stakeholders across the Enterprise to enable this vision to directly contribute to our bottom line.


**Responsibilities**


* Defining product vision, strategy and roadmap for your products.
* Own key stakeholder relationships with teams across the enterprise such as Technology, Risk, Compliance, Ops Excellence, C360, AENB Reg O Compliance, Financial Crimes, Mobile team and others.
* Owning product discovery by forming hypotheses, defining objectives and key results, and assessing options that best balance cost-benefit to achieve defined outcomes.
* Defining MVPs to meet strategic business outcomes while balancing innovation and efficiency.
* Identifying opportunities to reduce friction, increase automation and drive-up approval rates to generate incremental revenue via product enhancements and continuous experimentation, in partnership with analytics and UX research teams.
* Improving efficiency, scale and time-to-market by leveraging and enhancing our global platform architecture, in partnership with technology and other acquisition product teams.
* Leading, coaching and developing a team of Product Managers.
* Partnering with Solution Managers to define scalable solutions that meet current and future product needs.
* Delivering your goals and outcomes throughout the product life cycle, partnering with Agile Release Train Lead and Release Train Engineer to manage.
* Improving efficiency of planning and delivery by contributing to process and working practice improvements.


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Extensive Product Management experience in an Agile environment (5+ years).
* Proven ability to craft, drive, and maintain a product vision, strategy and prioritized backlog.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Able to simplify complex ideas, navigate cross-functional teams and build relationships, influence decisions, and deliver on shared objectives.
* Ability to coach and motivate a product team and foster a diverse and inclusive team culture, encouraging input from all team members.
* Demonstrated ability to analyze data and processes to identify creative solutions and drive incremental improvement.
* Ability to self-start, carve opportunities out of ambiguity, and operate with a high degree of independence.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Experience running cross-team Discovery for new products and product enhancements.
* Experience working in a regulated environment with an understanding of compliance, control, data governance and integrity processes.


Salary Range: $150,000.00 to $225,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Sales Operations Coordinator - Onsite (Retail & Promotions, Marketing)
description:
Description/Comment:

PROMOTIONS SPECIALIST

Years of Experience: 2-4 years

The Promotions Specialist – Optical Channel is responsible for performing and/or overseeing various activities relating to the sales team and customer programs in North America with a specific emphasis on the independent channel. The specialist supports the team in the design of quarterly promotions, sales incentives, and budget management related to these incentives.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Support promotional activities by managing the creation of promotion codes within SAP

Design impactful sales tools for promotional incentives using internal resources as well as working with outside agencies

Work closely with Business Development Analyst to support and build promotional reporting inclusive of sales consultant incentives and gift with purchase offers.

Write communications to sales team about promotional incentives

Manage payment, processing and follow up of promotional incentives within SAP system

Tracks and monitors spend on promotional activities by updating budget files.

Supports sales events in creation promotional tools .

Communication with internal departments promotional value set

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree

2-4 years of experience working sales operations, promotions, marketing.

Strong communication skills with the ability to interact effectively cross-functionally within the organization as well as with external customers.

title: Big SNOW- Guest Experience Manager (Blazer)
description:
**Guest Experience Manager (Blazer)**


Location: East Rutherford, NJ Reporting to: General Manager

**SNOW Partners Mission Statement:**


To Enhance the Lives of our Team, Guests and Partners by Building Lasting Connections.

**About Big SNOW:**


Big SNOW is North Americas first and only real snow, indoor, year-round ski and snowboard resort. We share our passion of sliding on snow with our guests.

**How the Guest Experience Manager (Blazer) works with the Team:**


The Guest Experience Blazer will lead customer facing positions in our Guest Experience trail providing superior customer service. This position oversees the functions of the guest experience: Guest Assistance, SnowCloud, Outfitting, Rentals.


In addition, they will be a member of the Big SNOW SLT (Senior Leadership Team). The SLT is a high functioning team that is responsible for leading the strategic direction of the facility.

**Team Member Responsibilities:**

* Oversee daily operations of the trail above to include timely product fulfillment, service recovery, and overall guest satisfaction.
* Motivate and maintain team culture through rewarding and recognizing the team, provide meaningful feedback, training, and discipline when needed, and reviews.
* Maintain daily communication of updates of products, events, discounts, prices, and SnowCloud updates
* Promote company safety culture through coaching and team work.
* Support our mission through consistent team work, a positive team member experience, and mutual respect.
* Proactively evaluate service gaps and guest situations and remedy them,
* Work with marketing to ensure all promotion codes are operational and have been reviewed with the Guides
* Establish work procedures and processes that support company and trail standards, procedures, and strategic directives.
* Oversee inventory rotations, cycle counts, full counts, and inventory.
* Design and conduct training of front-line staff to handle customer correspondence, complaints and inquiries in a professional manner.
* Maintain a safe and clean environment.
* Oversee rentals operations, rotations, and equipment inventory.
* Manage operational budget for labor and supplies while maximizing rental revenue goals.
* Hold weekly meetings with guides and ensure safety/weekly topics are being reviewed.
* Create and monitor daily checklists for all trail areas.

**Team Member Qualifications:**

* Must be 18+ years of age
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent of 2+ years of overseeing a customer facing function
* 2-3 years managing an operational environment including: inventory management, maximizing sales, managing teams, operational management, customer service
* Must be available to work on nights, weekends, holidays, and holiday periods
* High level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities.
* Superior interpersonal abilities
* Resourceful and strong organizational, time management, analytical, and problem solving skills
* Experience with face to face customer interaction
* Proven experience leading multiple teams

title: Business Analyst
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.


**Job Description**
-------------------

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Analyst with a strong background in corporate tax to join our team. The successful candidate will be in charge of for assessing and documenting the requirements for the consolidation of tax systems across the bank. They will work closely with stakeholders to be aware of business needs, define project objectives, and ensure successful implementation of tax-related solutions.


**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Gather and document business requirements for the tax system consolidation project.
* Conduct detailed analysis of current tax processes and identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives and key results.
* Develop and maintain project documentation, including process flows, requirements specifications, and user stories.
* Provide expertise in corporate tax regulations and ensure compliance with relevant laws and standards.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a focus on corporate tax.
* Strong understanding of tax regulations and compliance requirements.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
**Life at Capgemini**
---------------------

Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer:


* Flexible work
* Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs

* Paid time off and paid holidays
* Paid parental leave
* Family building benefits like adoption assistance, surrogacy, and cryopreservation
* Social well-being benefits like subsidized back-up child/elder care and tutoring
* Mentoring, coaching and learning programs
* Employee Resource Groups
* Disaster Relief

Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant.


http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law


**Salary Transparency Disclaimer**
----------------------------------

Capgemini discloses salary range information in compliance with state and local pay transparency obligations. The disclosed range represents the lowest to highest salary we, in good faith, believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting, although we may ultimately pay more or less than the disclosed range, and the range may be modified in the future. The disclosed range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, geographic location, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, performance, sales or revenue-based metrics, and business or organizational needs. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

title: Angular Tech Lead
description:
#### **Job Description**

Full-Stack Developer proficient in Angular, .NET Core, .NET MVC, WPF, MSSQL Server. As a key member of our development team, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain software applications that cater to our clients' needs.


Responsibilities:


* Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications using Angular, .NET Core, .NET MVC, WPF, MSSQL Server.
* Collaborate with product management and engineering teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Participate in architectural design sessions and product discussions.
* Write clean, scalable, and secure code adhering to company standards and best practices.
* Perform unit testing and conduct code reviews to ensure quality and maintainability.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimize performance and ensure robustness.
* Stay updated with the latest technologies and industry trends relevant to our tech stack.

Requirements:


* Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer or similar role with expertise in .NET Core, .NET MVC, WPF, MSSQL Server, and Angular.
* Strong proficiency in C#, ASP.NET MVC/Core, WPF/XAML, SQL Server, Entity Framework, and Angular (versions 2+).
* Solid understanding of front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, TypeScript, etc.
* Experience with RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, etc.) is a plus.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to addressing issues.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills with a team-oriented mindset.

title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)-Princeton
description:
Join Affirmed Home Care - New Jersey's Premier Concierge Home Care Agency!

Are you a compassionate and dedicated Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) looking for an exciting opportunity? Look no further! Affirmed Home Care is seeking talented individuals like YOU to join our exceptional team.

*The holiday season is a great time to make a difference by providing companionship to our clients, while also gaining some additional income! We're offering expedited onboarding to get you started quickly!*

Why choose Affirmed Home Care?

· Competitive Compensation: We offer weekly pay, ensuring that your hard work is rewarded promptly.

· Referral Bonuses: We value your recommendations! Earn generous referral bonuses for every qualified candidate you refer to us.

· Driving Incentives: If you have a valid driver's license and reliable transportation, we provide driving incentives to make your commute easier.

· Rapid Onboarding: We understand your time is valuable. Our streamlined onboarding process ensures a quick and hassle-free transition into our team.

· Quick Placement on Cases: We prioritize matching you with clients who align with your skills and preferences, ensuring a fulfilling and rewarding experience.

· Overtime Rates: We understand how valuable your time is. Any hours worked after 40 hours in one payroll period entitle you to a rate at time and one half.

Requirements:

· Valid CHHA license in the state of New Jersey.

· Eligibility to work in the United States.

· Up to date with COVID Vaccination in adherence to state Executive Orders.

· At least one year of prior home care experience is a plus!

At Affirmed Home Care, we believe in providing the highest quality care to our clients. As a CHHA, you will play a vital role in enhancing the lives of individuals in need. Your responsibilities may include assisting with personal care, medication reminders, light housekeeping, meal preparation, and companionship.

We value our employees and strive to create a supportive and inclusive work environment. Join our team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about making a difference in the lives of others.

Don't miss this incredible opportunity to work with New Jersey's premier concierge home care agency. Apply now and embark on a fulfilling career with Affirmed Home Care! Apply now, or call/text Brian at 646-586-3049 for more information!

title: Quality Assurance Specialist
description:
**1. Conducts multiple areas of evaluation, analysis, training and education, re: regulatory and compliance/risk management in conjunction with facility quality director and vice president of regulatory services.**

**2. Performs concurrent review and retrospective in-depth analysis of patient records for purposes of core measure and stroke care performance.**

**3. Interacts with physicians, nursing, and ancillary staff to promote accurate documentation to assure that evidence based best practices are implemented timely for core measures and stroke patients.**

**4. Queries the medical staff and other caregivers as necessary via written/verbal communication to obtain accurate and complete physician documentation that supports core measure and stroke care compliance before and/or after discharge.**

**5. Serves as resource for core measure/stroke care compliance for patients, staff, and physicians.**

**6. Promotes evidence based clinical practice standards with nursing staff through mentorship.** 

**7. Performs medical staff and clinical staff education on evidence based practices surrounding core measures, stroke care and other quality initiatives.**

**8. Assists in the planning and implementation of interventions to ensure evidence-based practices are implemented (i.e. Core Measures for AMI, HF, Pneumonia, SCIP, ED Throughput, VTE, and Global Immunizations) and (Stroke Care).**

**9. Works closely with providers, nurses and other members of the organization by**

**demonstrating effective communications, teaching and negotiating skills.** 

**Requirements/Qualifications:**

**1. Bachelor Degree in Nursing or related field, required. Masters Degree, preferred.**

**2. Current RN registration and license to practice in NY State.** 

**3. Minimum five (5) years of progressive clinical experience in an acute care setting. Clinical Documentation Improvement/Case Management/ Quality Assurance/Improvement experience preferred.**

**4. Previous experience in chart review required. Understand coding classifications systems such as, but not limited to ICD-9 CM/ICD-10, MS-DRGs & NYS AP-DRGs.**

**5. Ability to communicate effectively with physicians and other clinical professional staff.** 

**6. Competent computer skills including Microsoft word, excel, and power point. Must have strong analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis.** 

**7. CCS, C-CDIS, and/or CPHQ with experience is a plus**

**8. Inpatient surgical nursing.**

**9.** **Bilingual** **Spanish speaking preferred.**

**Days: Mon – Fri Shift: 7:00am-5:30pm & One Shift: 7:00am-5:00pm**

title: Task Force Manager
description:
**ABOUT OUR COMPANY**


Bridgeton is a fully integrated real estate investment, development and property management firm on a mission to create exceptional experiences by reimagining the built world. We manage ~$1B in premium assets, including office, hospitality and residential properties. Were growing quickly and need A-level talent.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**


Reporting to the Director of Hospitality, you will provide both short-term and long-term task force coverage within the Bridgeton portfolio in various management assignments. You will be responsible for consistently delivering results that contribute to the mission and overall success of the hotel by accomplishing performance objectives focused on driving revenue, controlling costs, providing guest and associate satisfaction, and delivering product and service quality. You may also provide support in a variety of other operational roles as well as assist with corporate projects and initiatives.

**Essential Duties**

* Ability to travel frequently between multiple properties (often multi-day trips).
* Strong ability to mentor other hotel department managers, to drive both engagement and job satisfaction.
* Strong ability to establish relationships and foster efficient, positive and proactive communication with department managers and employees.
* Ability to set both short-term and long-term goals, geared towards each individual propertys platform, with the ultimate goal of delivering financial success.
* Role may require the ability to drive a motor vehicle, stand, walk, sit, talk, hear, occasionally lift up to 25 lbs.

**Specific requirements of the role**

* Provide exceptional customer service to all hotel guests, making their stay as comfortable and accommodating as possible while achieving team and Brand goals.
* Ensures that all policies, procedures, federal, state, and local ordinances with regard to personnel, security, cash handling, guest relations, and safety are followed.
* Maintains and improves property standards and service to ensure guest satisfaction and the right public image.
* Ensure that the property and its inventories are always in the best conditions.
* Achieve budgeted revenue and profit goals, balancing cost with guest satisfaction.
* Comply with all corporate human resources and accounting procedures.
* Inspects property on a regular basis and enforces the implementation of actions toward the safety, comfort, and cleanliness of the hotel and guest satisfaction.
* Ensure property hiring and all employee practices comply with company and legal requirements and strive for a culturally diverse work place.
* Act as "Manager on duty" as required.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Hotel Management, General Business or Marketing degree preferred.
* Minimum two (2) years of management experience in Rooms department preferred.
* Ability to speak, read, and write fluent English.
* Professional verbal and written communication skills.
* Proven track record on driving in associate and customer service scores and delivering financial results.
* Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances.
* Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities.
* Ability to prioritize and organize work assignments.
* Ability to travel 100% of the time and be open to assignments of various duration and location.
* Valid drivers license required.

*The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Company are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Company will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics and encourages applicants of all ages.*

description:

-


Under the supervision of the Assistant Dir./Center Dir. or their designee, the Head Teacher shall be responsible for working within the framework of Harbor Child Care and carrying out its functions, educational philosophy, policies and procedures as follows but not limited to:

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**:


The Head Teacher is responsible for the planning and execution of a program that takes into account the educational, social development and health needs of the group as well as the individual child. The Head Teacher is responsible for active supervision of the Associate Teacher, Assistant Teacher, Aides and Substitute Teacher in all classroom activities, on and off school grounds. The Head Teacher is required to lift and carry children as well as physically actively participate in age appropriate activities for the class.

* Develops a program of developmentally appropriate practices.
* Upholds Harbors philosophy and policies, i.e. health & safety, nutrition and regulations as stated in the Parent Policy, New Employee Welcome Manual and Employee Handbook.
* Actively implements age appropriate The Creative Curriculum.
* Respects the confidential nature of all information about parents, children and staff.
* Supports and participates in an active outdoor time.
* Plans with all classroom staff and keeps them informed regarding meetings, events and training.
* Brings to the attention of the Assistant Director/Director any difficulties concerning the supervision of classroom staff.
* Responsible for supervision of the children or for designating appropriately qualified personnel in your absence as well as inform Assistant Teacher/Director.
* Supports and actively participates in an active work time.
* Works with Assistant Director/Director concerning children with special needs.


Record keeping


Parent Relations

* Fosters positive parent relationships through respecting the confidential nature of all information about parents and children.
* Provides a forum for ongoing communication daily notes, phone calls, etc.
* Uses Contact Notes for staff and parent concerns.
* Attends and participates in parent/teacher meetings.


Self-Evaluation

* Assumes responsibility for discussing his/her professional performance objectively at regularly scheduled supervisor conferences with the Education Coordinator or Program Director using these conferences as a source of information and professional guidance.


Trainings/Meetings

* Attends required staff meetings, trainings and workshops
* Attends weekly planning meetings with the Education Director or Program Director.


H.S. Diploma or GED with CDA or AA/BA/MA in Early Childhood Education.


Experience working with children between the ages of 3 and 18 months.


Must have availability between 7am and 6pm. Shifts vary.

title: RN FT NIGHTS ICU OVERLOOK
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Administers medications to patients and monitors them for side effects and reactions.
  

3. Prescribes assistive medical devices and related treatments.
  

4. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

5. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

6. Records patient vital signs and medical information.
  

7. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor degree in Nursing or related field.
  

2. 3+ years of experience in Nursing or relevant area.
  

3. Current state licensure as a Registered Nurse and BLS certification required.
  

4. ACLS certification.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Masters degree in Nursing or related field.


  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ
* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ
* Goryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJ
* CentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJ
* Atlantic Home Care and Hospice
* Atlantic Mobile Health
* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years
* Best Places to Work in Healthcare - Modern Healthcare
* 150 Top Places to work in Healthcare - Becker's Healthcare
* 100 Accountable Care Organizations to Know - Becker's Hospital Review
* Best Employers for Workers over 50 - AARP
* Gold-Level "Well Workplace": Wellness Council of America (WELCOA)
* One of the 100 Best Workplaces for “Millennials” Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business

Named one of America's 50 Best Hospitals by Healthgrades, a World’s Best Hospital by Newsweek and recognized as a Best Regional Hospital in the NY Metro area by U.S. News & World Report.
  

  

Our Atlantic Neuroscience Institute is the region’s leader in neuroscience care. A hub for the New Jersey Stroke Network, we offer a broad range of advanced neurological, neurosurgical and neurodiagnostic services. We are also certified as a Level IV Epilepsy Center and home to the Gerald J. Glasser Brain Tumor Center, where more brain tumor surgeries are performed than anywhere else in New Jersey. Our CyberKnife® program is the largest and most experienced in the state. We also have a satellite emergency department in Union, NJ, which treats about 40,000 emergency cases each year.
  

  

Committed to providing exceptional care, Overlook Medical Center has achieved the prestigious Magnet® recognition. This designation from the American Nurses Credentialing Center is the highest national honor for nursing excellence. What’s more, Overlook Medical Center has advanced certification from The Joint Commission for perinatal care and is designated an Advanced Comprehensive Stroke Center. Additional Joint Commission-certified services include behavioral health care, spine surgery, wound care, and primary care medical home (PCMH).
  

  

EEO STATEMENT
  

  

Atlantic Health System, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor and therefore abides by applicable laws to protect applicants and employees from discrimination in hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral, and other aspects of employment, on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, genetics, or veteran status.

3. Minimum 6 months of steady work history.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Knowledge of and familiarity with hospital equipment, supplies and procedures.
  

2. Ability to identify clinical and environmental emergency/urgent situations and to follow established procedures.
  

3. Highly effective interpersonal communication skills to interface with inter-professional staff, patients, families, visitors, and other hospital employees.


  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ

* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ

* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years

* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business

Morristown Medical Center is a nationally-recognized leader in cardiology and heart surgery, orthopedics, gynecology, geriatrics, gastroenterology and GI surgery, pulmonology and lung surgery, and urology.  



  

We are the only hospital in New Jersey named one of America's '50 Best Hospitals' for six consecutive years by Healthgrades and one of the World's Best Hospitals by Newsweek. We were included on Becker's Healthcare 2020 list of "100 Great Hospitals in America". In addition, Leapfrog recognized us with an "A" hospital safety grade - its highest - twelve consecutive times, and the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services awarded us again with its highest five-start rating in 2020.  



  

Morristown Medical Center is a Magnet Hospital for Excellence in Nursing Service, the highest level of recognition achievable from the American Nurses Credentialing Center for facilities that provide acute care services. Our nonprofit hospital was also designated a Level I Regional Trauma Center by the American College of Surgeons and a Level II by the State of NJ.

title: ELA Teacher (2024-2025 School Year)
description:
**ELA Teacher Grades 7-8**

**Job Description**

The Intellectus Prep Middle School ELA Teacher is a creative practitioner with long-term vision and a desire to prepare our scholars with the social awareness, and intellectual capacity to be active in the forward development of their own communities. They nurture an emotionally healthy learning environment that will motivate all children in ways that encourage them to welcome challenges in pursuit of high academic goals and to develop into independent, critical, inquisitive, socially-aware and responsive thinking. These educators guide scholars to be active participants in their own educational journey and provide opportunities for scholars to use their awareness to contribute positively to their communities.

Curriculum and Planning

* Develop deliberately student-centered and engaging lessons that encourage scholars to be leaders of their own learning and to use their knowledge in relevant ways.
* Embed reflection of core values in each lesson to allow students to make direct correlations
* Use assessment data to identify gaps in knowledge and understanding, and inform individual, small group, and whole group reteaching, and to help scholars create academic goals and set milestones
* Plan and maintain a conferencing cycle for all scholars to help move scholars towards academic goals, and maintain the necessary records of student progress toward academic goals (ie. portfolios)
* Create a culture of feedback and revision that promotes a growth-mindset and a love of learning that leads students to welcome challenges and celebrate growth
* Facilitate scholar ownership of portfolio work to foster a love of self-growth, and love of learning, and reflective practice
* Work collaboratively with team level colleagues to plan and share ideas and address concerns
* Provide the differentiation and accommodations needed for the growth and success of all students; go above and beyond to ensure that all students are meeting appropriate standards

Classroom Culture

* Maintain an collaborative learning environment that cultivates leadership and pride in/accountability to the school community through responsibilities within the class/school community
* Facilitate Morning Meeting to help maintain the school-wide cultural expectations and norms
* Build healthy, genuine relationships with scholars that enhance their school experience
* Actively reinforcing SEL strategies to help student to engage positively within their school community and with peers

Communication and Collaboration

* Fully embrace Intellectus Prep’s mission and values and promote them to students, parents, and colleagues
* Collaborate as part of department teams and as needed, coordinating all instructional activities with teachers, assistants, and instructional leaders; collaborate with other staff to envision and execute projects
* Serve as Advisory Leader for students
* Proactively seek assistance or advice when faced with challenging teaching situations;
* Maintain positive relationships with and support the learning of all staff members
* Appropriately give and receive feedback to/from students, parents, faculty, staff, and administration
* Keep families well-informed of student performance and progress
* Model strong written and verbal skills

Professionalism

* Fully participate in all school and departmental and grade meetings, designated school functions outside of school hours, and opportunities for individual and school-wide professional development
* Meet expectations including punctuality and professionalism in conversation and in writing; consistently meet deadlines and communicate frequently and appropriately on progress on projects and goals.
* Reflect on professional practice through self-reflection and engagement in informal and formal feedback processes
* Exhibits pose and tact when addressing scholars, colleagues, staff, and parents

Personal Attributes

* Unwavering belief that all scholars can learn at a high level
* A genuine passion to serve the scholars from the communities for which we serve
* Positive attitude, and solution-oriented
* Ability to be self-directed, while being able to take direction
* Organized and systems driven
* Community, social-justice, and service oriented

Educational Background and Work Experience

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university required
* Understanding of Common Core Learning Standards and Next Generation Learning Standards
* Successful experience working with and/or teaching children in urban middle school grades required
* Experience with and interest in working with high needs students preferred
* New York State teaching certification in the required area preferred
* Experience with UBD, UDL, and SEL are a plus

**Please note this position starts with teacher training during the month of August.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you fully vaccinated for COVID-19, and able to provide a vaccination card?
* Required: Do you live in or near Mount Vernon, NY 10550?

Language:

* English (Preferred)
* Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Teaching Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Warehouse / Forklift Operator
description:
New Castle Building Products (NCBP) is a full-service distributor based in White Plains, NY. All our 20+ locations from Massachusetts to Baltimore operate with these core values as their driving force. We look for team members who will display and share these values with fellow employees and customers.


Our locationbased in***Brooklyn***is seeking a full time***Warehouse/Forklift Operator***. Candidates should have the ability to function in a dynamic warehouse environment and order fulfillment is a plus.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Frequent lifting and moving of material up to 70 pounds

**MAIN JOB TASKS & REQUIREMENTS**

* Loading and unloading trucks of building materials including the checking-in of material
* Fulfilling customer orders from stock based on work orders
* Load building materials onto pallets and shelves for either delivery or for receipt into the warehouse

* Operate forklift in a safe manner with proper safety equipment
* Organize warehouse for orderliness at all times

* Unparalleled work environment


If this sounds like you, please complete the application and also complete a brief survey once the application is submitted which will pop up on your screen.
